data.name: Confidentiality_Description
data.value:
• We commit ourselves to safeguard the interests of our clients as our own and divulge no confidential information.
  • Our translation team and collaborators shall not disclose information acquired during the course of their assignments.
  • Translated documents remain the client's property.
  • Our translation team and our company may only disclose information with the permission of our clients (or if the law requires disclosure.)
Our confidentiality principles are based on the following Codes of Ethics: ATA (American Translators Association) and ATTI (Argentinian translators and interpreters Association.)

data.name: Guarantees_Description
data.value: Our compromise is to deliver translated assignments with the high standard of quality and always considering our clients’ urgency. To accomplish this, we work with qualified and specialised linguists. In addition, if any translated document does not fulfill our client’s expectation, we will provide a revision and a version free of charge to satisfy our clients’ needs (conditions and terms are stipulated from the start.)

data.name: HowDoWeWork_Description
data.value:
Working mode

Our translators have extensive linguistic knowledge and translate solely and exclusively towards their source language. Our working mode is based on different tools and processes. Every project you entrust us follows the same process, in accordance with a rigorous methodology that guarantees an optimal result. According to the project, the steps are as follows:
  1. Analysis of the Project: The project manager analyses the files, (format, specific terminology, amount of words, etc) considering the particular constraints of the project (target language, deadlines, target audience.)
  2. Quote: The project manager prepares a quotation taking into account the number of documents, source and target languages, deadline and services requested: translation/desktop publishing/edition/amount of words/etc.
  3. Translation: The project manager collects all of the information of the project (reference documents, translation memories, glossaries, etc) and prepares the files. After that, the project manager assigns the project to the translator or team of translators that best suit to your request.
  4. Desktop publishing: All layout work is entrusted to the same designer, thus ensuring graphic consistency between the various language versions of the same project.
  5. Proofreading: The translated document is revised by an editor who ensures uniformity of style and terminology, so that the delivered document contains no omissions or errors such as: punctuation, spelling, grammar, patterns, typos, etc. thus guaranteeing the text meets all quality requirements for final delivery to the customer.

data.name: Services_Description
data.value:
We translate from English into Spanish different types of documents related to the following subject matter:
  • Industry (Energy, Oil, Cosmetic, Tourism, Pharmaceutical, Construction.)
  • Business (Commerce, Finance, Economics, Accountancy, Legal.)
  • Technology (Information Technology, Video Games applications, Computing.)
  • Culture (Fashion, Travel, Cookery, Music, Literature.)
  • Science (Medicine, Psychology, Architecture, Environment, Social Science.)
  • Journalism
Our total commitment is to satisfy your expectations. Therefore, our goal is to accurately convey the information you need to communicate. We achieve this goal by working with a specialized translation team, and by subjecting every translated document to the following method: translation, edition and post- edition. Thereby, we can fully meet all our customers’ needs.
